text: Charles Carroll of Carrollton (September 19, 1737 â€“ November 14 1832) was a delegate to the Continental Congress and later United States Senator for Maryland. He was the only Catholic signer of the Declaration of Independence. He was the longest lived signer of the Declaration of Independence and the Continental Congress, dying at the age of 95. He was a rich planter. Although he opposed slavery he had slaves. == References == Category:1737 births Category:1832 deaths Category:American Roman Catholics Category:People from Annapolis, Maryland Category:Signers of the U.S. Declaration of Independence Category:United States senators from Maryland
title: Charles Carroll of Carrollton
